subclusters.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
Cell Cycle Inhibitors and Molecular Pathways Regulating Senescence
Immune Cell Senescence and Clonal Dynamics in Aging

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of senescent cells, SASP secretion causing inflammation and tissue repair impairment, and therapeutic targeting of senescent cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP-driven chronic inflammation, senescent cell accumulation in vascular disease, and paracrine senescence effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP secretion, epigenetic and metabolic changes in senescent cells, and dual roles in physiology and pathology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell accumulation and senolytic therapies reducing SASP-related aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights senescent cell accumulation, SASP secretion, and their causal role in organ dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes irreversible arrest, SASP secretion, accumulation with age, and senolytic clearance improving healthspan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP regulation by NF-kB and related pathways, metabolic changes, and systemic aging effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explores dynamic SASP communication, microenvironment remodeling, and dual beneficial/detrimental roles of SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details senescent cell accumulation impairing wound healing via SASP-mediated inflammation and tissue remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence-induced irreversible arrest, SASP paracrine effects causing tissue dysfunction, and therapeutic targeting.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP-driven chronic inflammation, metabolic dysfunction, and calorie restriction reducing senescent cell burden.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cell Cycle Inhibitors and Molecular Pathways Regulating Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on molecular pathways (p16INK4a, p19ARF, TP53, RB1, JAK/STAT, WNT) regulating senescence induction and maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cell Cycle Inhibitors and Molecular Pathways Regulating Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes role of p19INK4d in cell cycle arrest, heterochromatin formation, and senescence maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cell Cycle Inhibitors and Molecular Pathways Regulating Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p16INK4a as a marker and mediator of senescence and its role in durable cell cycle arrest.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cell Cycle Inhibitors and Molecular Pathways Regulating Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes telomere shortening, DNA damage response, and INK4 family inhibitors in replicative senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cell Cycle Inhibitors and Molecular Pathways Regulating Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes molecular pathways driving senescence including telomere shortening, oncogene-induced senescence, and p53 signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cell Cycle Inhibitors and Molecular Pathways Regulating Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows senescence induction independent of telomere shortening, DNA damage accumulation, and apoptosis resistance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cell Cycle Inhibitors and Molecular Pathways Regulating Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p16INK4a regulation of neural stem cell quiescence and aging-related proliferative arrest.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Cell Senescence and Clonal Dynamics in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes clonal senescence and succession in T cells during persistent viral infection affecting immune aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Cell Senescence and Clonal Dynamics in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links macrophage-induced nitric oxide production to DNA damage response and senescence in inflammation-associated aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and p53 Isoform-Mediated Senescence Regulation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS-induced senescence, protective role of p53 isoform Δ133p53 in antioxidant defense, and brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and p53 Isoform-Mediated Senescence Regulation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence contribution to neurodegenerative diseases and functional decline of senescent neural cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence driving fibrosis via SASP secretion and stem cell exhaustion impairing tissue repair.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights dual role of senescence and SASP in aging and regeneration, including beneficial paracrine signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Interactions
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-dependent decline in autophagy leading to accumulation of damaged components contributing to senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence and Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes stress response cross-talk with senescence pathways causing premature senescence and biochemical decline driving aging.
